channel.title: [Tut] Smart-url
channel.description:
Smart-url is just like runescape, in the way that it always says "www.runescape.com"
instead of the main index.html in your site, put the following. [code]<html><head><title>Rs2Codes - Helping the Community One Step At A Time</head><frameset border="0" rows="100%,*" cols="100%" frameborder="no"><frame name="TopFrame" scrolling="yes" noresize src="REAL HOMEPAGE URL"><frame name="BottomFrame" scrolling="no" noresize><noframes></noframes></frameset></html> [/code] the real homepage url is what used to show up at your site...
add this before the <body> in each of your pages [code]<script language='javascript'>try { if (top == self) {top.location.href='www.yoursite.com'; } } catch(er) { } </SCRIPT> [/code]
im not really good at describing html... so tell me how to make this sound... less confusing

item.title: [Tut] Smart-url
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:4, topic:66506”]i personally HATE THIS!

you cant bookmark shit

think about if u had to go thru moparisthebest.com each time u wanted to go to forums…[/quote]

I do that because some time ago I lost the fave for moparisthebest and accidentally set it at the home page :[

Now im too lazy to change it back.

Read full topic

item.title: [Tut] Smart-url
item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

if it doesnt appear as “http://www.Rs2Codes.com”, it will change the url in your browser to it… so you cant go to “www.rs2codes.com/StarterKit/” without going through homepage, etc…

Read full topic

item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

looks awesome. so your real website is http://rs2codes.awardspace.com but it appears in the address bar as www.rs2codes.com?

Read full topic

add this before the in each of your pages
